summary: What are your thoughts on Bran sitting on the IT? I don’t really understand how it ends up with him - is it because he’s the...
question: What are your thoughts on Bran sitting on the IT? I don’t really understand how it ends up with him - is it because he’s the 3ER? Does Jon offer it to him for “saving them” from the NK? Wouldn’t that make Arya just as qualified, if not more, for the IT? Bran doesn’t have any claims to it either; that would be either Gendry or Tyrion. I know there’s no point in trying to make sense of any of this, but if this is GRRM’s actual ending with King Bran - how??
answer:
I have no idea, in the show it feels like…. just, what

Ironically enough though, Bran sort of would be a perfect King - I mean, he’s essentially medieval CCTV, right? If any threat to him was coming, or anyone was planning to take him down, he would be able to nip it in the bud immediately like “Yo bitch, saw you were conspiring against me. Nah, not happening, get out.” 

Back to being serious for a moment, him being 3ER probably is part of the choice. He has the entirety of human history in his head, and (much as I despise it in the show) he’s said he isn’t really Bran anymore. He’s the closest thing they have to a neutral individual, who doesn’t really have loyalty one specific way or another, beyond just ‘humanity’s survival’. Gendry is certainly the one with the strongest claim after Daenerys, and the fact he’s still legitimised but nobody’s bothered to mention this baffles me. But maybe the whole point is they want to put an end to this bloodline system - but as with everything in S8, the narrative just hasn’t been built up enough for this to be rationally a logical decision.

I can understand the logic behind choosing Bran, but I don’t think the narrative serves it well. We’ll see. (I say, grinding my teeth)

tags: not to be one of THOSE PEOPLE BUT
I feel like Bran is proof that nothing that has happened this season was part of  the plan
summary: It’s a huge problem when you can lift Bran Stark, one of if not the most important characters in the book series, right out of...
title: It’s a huge problem when you can lift Bran Stark, one of if not the most important characters in the book series, right out of the show without affecting the plot at all.
body:
Bran being pushed from the window doesn’t really change the fact that Westeros was going to war, Stannis and Jon Arryn had already done their investigation into Cersei’s children, Littlefinger had already convinced Lysa to kill Jon to cause more chaos and suspicion, and Cersei was already planning to kill Robert to stop him from discovering what Stannis had. We don’t know if Renly was plotting with Highgarden before everything went down (I don’t think he was given that we replace the Margaery picture scene with Loras shaving him and telling him to seize power) but the only thing in regards to TWOTFK that really changes is that it probably starts a little later, and might only involve four kings if Ned doesn’t have a reason to investigate Jon’s death (though I imagine Littlefinger would still get him to).

In terms of the White Walkers, Bran doesn’t actually do anything to destroy them, he does see that vision of their creation, and Arya’s killing of The Night King mirrors that shot, but Arya doesn’t know about that, and even if she had been told it would have been Mel and not Bran who did it. 

If the magic works, as some people have suggested, in a way that means the Night King HAD to be killed in front of a weir wood with a dagger through the heart then that’s also is a problem, because while Bran chose to wait in the Godswood, he never informed anyone about a specific method of killing the Night King, never clarified if there was anything more than just stabbing him with dragon glass or Valyrian steel on any part of his body.

So in terms of destroying the White Walkers, what did Bran actually do? The Night’s Watch plot provides us with all the information in regards to how to destroy them (Jon and Sam in particular with their dragon glass and Valyrian steel murders of the Walkers), Stannis in S5 and Sam in S7 tell us that there’s dragon glass on Dragonstone, we get some minor Daenerys burning them with dragonfire, but we get nothing from Bran EXCEPT what he does to Hodor.

Which is pretty fucked. But also…why did that happen?

If the point was to teach Bran responsibility with his powers it’s a bit wasted considering he hasn’t really used his powers since. Like at all. Since this incident Bran has warged (as far as I can remember) only ravens, but this isn’t presented as Bran fearing what his powers do, because as Bran says he spends most of his time in the past despite the fact that being in the past is as much to blame for what happened as warging is. Everything after this point is Bran having the past beamed into him, and him dissociating as a result, and none of it matters.

Bran’s ability to see all of time hasn’t been allowed to have much impact on the plot, we don’t see him use it to do something like discover the appropriate magic to help Mel resurrect Jon, or help rally support for the Battle of the Bastards, or stop Sansa and Arya from fighting when they reunite, or help Jon find a wight without being attacked by the entire army of the dead.

The only thing he uses it for is to view Rhaegar and Lyanna’s wedding.

Here’s  another why we have to discuss.

Other than showing the creation of the Night King, Bloodraven only personally showed Bran memories related to Rhaegar and Lyanna. Sure, we see him get flashes of things like Aery’s, and Cersei’s wildfire, and Craster’s baby, but when he connects to the weirwood just beyond the wall, the memory he views is Jon’s birth. 

He keeps it a secret all of S7, only talking to Sam because he already knows, and telling him that Jon is the true heir to the throne.  He then insists in S8 that Jon needs to know. But he doesn’t say why. Jon knowing has only caused conflict, and yet it is the absolute and only thing Bran has done with his vast knowledge (oh, and build wheelchair). 

So if Jon doesn’t end up on the throne as King Aegon VI, and honestly we could flip a coin on how this is going to end at this point, then what was the point of any of it?
body_abstract: Bran being pushed from the window doesn’t really change the fact that Westeros was going to war, Stannis and Jon Arryn had already done their investigation into Cersei’s children, Littlefinger had already convinced Lysa to kill Jon to cause more chaos and suspicion, and Cersei was already planning to kill Robert to stop him from discovering what Stannis had. summary: Game of Thrones | vaza possível roteiro do episódio final
title: Game of Thrones | vaza possível roteiro do episódio final
body:
Game of Thrones | vaza possível roteiro do episódio final

Wow, quem vive e quem morre no grand finale!

O fim de Game of Thrones está diante de nós. Uma das séries de maior sucesso dos últimos tempos encerra a sua história – para o bem ou para o mal – neste próximo domingo, dia 19 de maio, pela HBO.

A 8ª temporada da série tem provocado reações acaloradas pelos fãs – alguns diriam com tanta raiva e “fogo nos olhos” quanto Daenerys em Porto Real. A…

External image

Wow, quem vive e quem morre no grand finale!

O fim de Game of Thrones está diante de nós. Uma das séries de maior sucesso dos últimos tempos encerra a sua história – para o bem ou para o mal – neste próximo domingo, dia 19 de maio, pela HBO.

A 8ª temporada da série tem provocado reações acaloradas pelos fãs – alguns diriam com tanta raiva e “fogo nos olhos” quanto Daenerys em Porto Real. A…

View On WordPress

summary: If you are asking how could Game of Thrones ruin it’s main character like that, you never understood Game of Thrones at all....
body: If you are asking how could Game of Thrones ruin it’s main character like that, you never understood Game of Thrones at all. Yes, I hate what they did to her too, but is very important to understand this story has never been about D*ny, or J*nerys, or Tyrion, etc. Is about the Starks. If those three kids get their happy ending, then the show will still end true to itself, because it’s always been about them.

summary:
Sansa: Bran, what's going on over there?
Bran:...They are keeping themselves warm.
Sansa: That's nice. The cold bothers those...
body:
Sansa: Bran, what’s going on over there?

Bran:…They are keeping themselves warm.

Sansa: That’s nice. The cold bothers those not of the North. Hey maybe Queen Dany can make herself useful and have her Dragon light up some flames so the people don’t freeze their toes off.

Bran: I’m sure that was her sentiment when she burned Kings landing to the ground.

Sansa: Wait What!!!!

blog.description:
Hi.
I love you.
Yes, you. You're beautiful.
And don't you forget it.
I'm Tasha, 23, from London, England. I love various British comedies, Death in Paradise, Father Brown, Doctor Who, Midsomer Murders, Eurovision, Casualty, Holby, old sci-fi, and many kid's shows (mostly CBBC, CBBC is my life.)
Feel free to send me an ask any time! Tell me about your day! Ask me about my OTPs! Tell me about your OTPs! I'll listen.

summary: Reasons Bran Stark would be the best possible monarch out of all the current likely candidates for the iron throne, actually:
body:
Reasons Bran Stark would be the best possible monarch out of all the current likely candidates for the iron throne, actually:

  • The downfall of almost every single monarch and leader in the entire show has been either them being betrayed, or them having a terrible misunderstanding of what actually happened. Bran would never have to have this problem
  • Bran “doesn’t really want anything anymore”, and thus is inherently unselfish and ungreedy, another common downfall of monarchs and rulers in this show
  • Bran would be able to tell when any invading armies were approaching and would be able to fully prepare his own armies
  • If any subjects came to him with petty disagreements and disputes he would be able to tell which of them was telling the truth and solve the situation fairly
  • He’s unfailingly calm and polite, never losing his temper or letting emotions rule, this would give him the reputation of a calm and measured monarch and likely make him popular and respected with mobility, visiting dignitaries and foriegn leaders, despite his young age
  • He’d be fantastic at learning from the mistakes of the past, because he could observe the mistakes of the past in detail

  • He’s unfailingly calm and polite, never losing his temper or letting emotions rule, this would give him the reputation of a calm and measured monarch and likely make him popular and respected with mobility, visiting dignitaries and foriegn leaders, despite his young age
  • He’d be fantastic at learning from the mistakes of the past, because he could observe the mistakes of the past in detail

  • Bran would be able to tell when any invading armies were approaching and would be able to fully prepare his own armies
  • If any subjects came to him with petty disagreements and disputes he would be able to tell which of them was telling the truth and solve the situation fairly
  • He’s unfailingly calm and polite, never losing his temper or letting emotions rule, this would give him the reputation of a calm and measured monarch and likely make him popular and respected with mobility, visiting dignitaries and foriegn leaders, despite his young age

summary: AND ANOTHER THING    What was the whole deal with Bran and Jaime’s conversation about how Jaime had changed and was now where he...
body:
AND ANOTHER THING




What was the whole deal with Bran and Jaime’s conversation about how Jaime had changed and was now where he needed to be? Only for him to fuck off to King’s Landing two episodes later. It’s not like he played a crucial role in the Battle of Winterfell. Was Bran just trolling or was he weirdly invested in Brienne losing her virginity? 

I hate all of this.

title: Bran Stark, The Chilled-out Sage
body:
Leaders like Bran are visionaries and don’t panic at the drop of a hat. Instead, they calmly guide the crusaders whenever the waters are stormy.

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/game-thrones-characters-teach-lessons-leadership-whats-bhavana-pandey/
